intro: Crotalaria karagwensis, commonly known as the Karagwe crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in grasslands and woodland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with distinctive spurred petals that attract pollinators. The seeds are enclosed in pods and are an important food source for various wildlife species.
